headline: Author, Holocaust Survivor Elie Wiesel Dies
summary: Nobel laureate and Holocaust survivor Elie Wiesel has died at the age of 87. His autobiographical work “Night” depicted the horrors he witnessed as a teenager in the Nazi concentration camps.

headline: Hillary Clinton Interviewed by FBI in Email Probe
summary: Presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton was interviewed by the FBI on Saturday as part of a probe into whether any classified information was compromised by her use of a private server while secretary of state.

headline: Elie Wiesel’s Life in Photos
summary: Nobel laureate and Holocaust survivor Elie Wiesel has died. He was 87 years old.

headline: Enterprise Rent-A-Car Founder Dies at 94
summary: Jack Taylor started the leasing company with seven cars in 1957, renting them to customers whose own vehicles were undergoing repair.

headline: Bangladesh Attack Details Slowly Emerge
summary: Authorities are questioning survivors and an attacker from the hostage crisis at a Bangladesh cafe as details from the siege slowly emerge.

headline: German Agency Says Islamic State Operatives Posed as Refugees
summary: Seventeen operatives of Islamic State have entered Germany disguised as refugees, according to evidence collected by the country’s domestic intelligence agency.

headline: Thousands Protest in London Against Brexit
summary: Several thousand people marched through central London to protest against the U.K. leaving the European Union after a national vote last week to exit the bloc.

headline: Bundesbank Opposes Weakening EU Financial Rules
summary: Jens Weidmann, Germany’s chief central banker, spoke out against weakening the European Union’s financial rules in the wake of the U.K.’s vote to leave the bloc.

headline: Islamic State Suicide Bomber Attacks Afghan Militia Leader
summary: The target survived, but two others were killed and at least 18 people were wounded in the Jalalabad blast.

headline: Bangladesh Hostage Hadn’t Expected to Survive
summary: Civil engineer Hasnat Karim saw the Holey Artisan Bakery as a refuge from the Bangladeshi capital’s usual chaos. That was before the terror attack Friday that killed 20 hostages.

headline: Macedonian Police Find 73 Migrants Hidden in Truck
summary: Most of them are women with children, according to police in the small Balkan country between Greece and Serbia.

headline: William B. Johnson Created the Ritz-Carlton Hotel Chain
summary: William B. Johnson was the owner of Waffle House and created the Ritz-Carlton hotel chain. He had a good eye for promising locations, whether for lowly diners or posh hotels, and was willing to pay for top executive talent. He died June 12 at age 79.

headline: The Shale Boom’s New Winner: Propane
summary: The U.S. is exporting record volumes of propane, another way in which the shale boom has made the nation a more dominant force in the global energy trade.

headline: Injury Hamstrings Usain Bolt at Olympic Trials
summary: The world’s fastest man said he has withdrawn from the Jamaican Olympic track-and-field trials with a hamstring injury, but hopes to be given an exemption to make the national team for the Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro.

headline: What’s News: World-Wide
summary: What’s News: World-Wide

headline: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Pepper...and Salt

headline: Top Seed Djokovic Loses at Wimbledon to Querrey of U.S.
summary: Top-seeded Novak Djokovic, seeking to complete a calendar Grand Slam, instead lost to 28th-ranked American Sam Querrey on Saturday in the third round at Wimbledon.

headline: What’s News: Business & Finance
summary: What’s News: Business & Finance

headline: Germany Edges Italy in Euro 2016 Quarterfinal
summary: Germany’s Manuel Neuer and Italy’s Gianluigi Buffon had little to do in their teams’ Euro 2016 quarterfinal match, until the 1-1 draw went to 18 penalty kicks. Germany ultimately prevailed to move on to the semifinals.

headline: Elie Wiesel, a Voice for the Oppressed
summary: For more than 50 years, Romanian-born Holocaust survivor Elie Wiesel voiced his passionate beliefs to world leaders and general audiences in the name of victims of violence and oppression through books and speeches.

headline: Tesla’s ‘Autopilot’ Got Scant Oversight
summary: U.S. auto-safety regulators have advocated for many of the technologies Tesla Motors uses in its autonomous-driving system, but had little power to stop or impose requirements on how it released its Autopilot technology.

headline: California Lowers the Bar for Gun Seizures
summary: New legislation aims to prevent the next mass shooting by temporarily confiscating guns from people considered a danger to themselves or others.

headline: Bangladesh Victims’ Nationalities Include American, Japanese, Italian
summary: Three students attending U.S. universities were among victims of a terrorist attack at a cafe in Bangladesh on Friday, as were several Italians in the garment industry and Japanese aid workers.
